column5: Well the weekend was getting close, and there were no plans on the calendar for us to be up North, but the wife could tell I was getting a bit antsy.  She suggested that maybe I needed a bit of "me-time" and that I should go do a bit of fishing on Saturday.  WOW do I ever love her  I didn't want to skip out on the family for the entire day, so I headed to a lake I've never fished that was within a couple hours of home.  Walked out to a decent spot with 35 FOW under me and jigged up my new PB crappie.  I lost another one that felt about the same, so I'm pretty sure I'll be going back when I get the chance.  Nice morning on the iceâ€¦.just what the doctor ordered.  A few pics:
Great outing. Always good to get out on the ice....especially when the wife suggests it.
Beautiful fish there man.  The gold and silver hues pop.  Way to go on your pb.  What is the critter in pic 2?
Beauty fish, Johnny. Looks like a great, peaceful outing. Thanks for posting.
Woo hoo, another one for your record books

Thanks guys....critter in pic #2 was a really healthy red fox. Hopped on the ice a stone's throw away from me, and sniffed around a bit, but by the time I got the phone out for a pic, he was crossing the lake at a good clip
Thanks for the report. Looks like you had the whole place to yourself too !!!
Congrats on the PB! I've always been looking for a crappie spot that you have to yourself, looks like I still gotta do some finding!
nice report. Still waiting for the wife to tell me to go fishing some day...I'll admit, if that day ever comes I'll be VERY suspicious!
congrats on your pb johnny nice slab
